snippet: Mr. Brink’s work was often cited alongside that of Nadine Gordimer and J.M. Coetzee as an exemplar of South Africa’s ability to transform the experience of harsh racial politics into literature with a global reach.
abstract: Andre Brink, South African writer who translated experience of country's fraught racial politics to wide literary audience, despite having his works banned at home, dies at age 79.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Brink’s work was often cited alongside that of Nadine Gordimer and J.M. Coetzee as an exemplar of South Africa’s ability to transform the experience of harsh racial politics into literature with a global reach.

headline.main: André Brink, South African Literary Lion, Dies at 79
headline.print_headline: André Brink, South African Literary Lion, Dies at 79
